results.title: In the air is Christopher Gray
results.brief_description:
A series of unfortunate events leads to disaster when young Christopher Gray tries to impress the girl of his dreams.
Written, directed and animated by Felix Massie.
Cast: Andy London, Peter Ahern, Justin Cassano, Carolyn London, Ian Miller, Erica Perez
Soundtrack: Joe Paine
Sound design and mix: Marty O’Brien

results.title: Subconscious Password
results.creator_credit: Mark Smith, Marcy Page, Chris Landreth, Seneca College Animation Arts Centre, Copperheart Entertainment and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Most of us have had at least one of those excruciating social encounters where you can’t remember someone’s name. Just what is your subconscious up to while you frantically try to recall it?
Cast includes: Don McKellar, Ron Pardo, Patrice Goodman, Ray Landry, Tony Daniels, Athena Karkanis, Nanci Pach, Kedar, Denise Oliver, Dwayne Hill, Chris Landreth and John R. Dilworth.
Music: Daniel Janke
Animation direction and layout: Sean Craig

results.title: I am Tom Moody
results.brief_description:
As the performer steps up to the microphone, will the desire to make music be defeated by fears of failure and feelings of inadequacy? The awful solitude of the spotlight forces Tom to confront his inner critic.
Written, directed and animated by Ainslie Henderson.
Voices: Mackenzie Crook, Jude Crook, Rick Webster
Music: Peter Deane
Compositing: Will Anderson
Sound design: Ainslie Henderson, Joe Acheson

results.title: Holy She*p
results.creator_credit: Magnus Kravik, Katerina Pantela and Arts University Bournemouth
results.brief_description:
Pursued by a nun with a shearing blade, a sheep tries frantically to escape. Does the cruise ship visiting his island hold a hope of sybaritic freedom? Perhaps, but not in quite the way our protagonist dreams.
Story and animation: Parina Mehta, Katerina Pantela, Magnus Kravik
Layout, background and design: Heather Vogel, Katerina Pantela
Assistant animators: Mengly Li, Dominic Elsey
Editors: Carl Reader, Thorbjorn Munter
Music and sound design: Daniel Weismayr

results.title: Show Me the Magic: The Adventures of Don McAlpine [Q&A]
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Cathy Henkel’s 2012 documentary ‘Show Me the Magic’ about Australian cinematographer Don McAlpine brought together personal and professional connections, including Gillian Armstrong, Bruce Beresford and Baz Lurhmann, to explore his life and career.

This question and answer session with Cathy Henkel and Don McAlpine, chaired by Rochelle Siemienowicz, was held at ACMI in September 2013 following a screening of the documentary.

results.title: Closure
results.brief_description: A young girl reflects on her connections with her family and friends and she attempts to discover why she feels like she is being ignored. She focuses on the experiences from her past but continually feels an intrinsic connection to water. Only later does she discover why this is the case.

results.title: Visiting Grandpa
results.creator_credit: Ethan Price, Ethan Hawkins, Riley Elson and Luke Breaden
results.brief_description: My name is Mick and I enjoy lots of exciting activities but not the activity of visiting Grandpa every Sunday. That is, until I find a photo album and discover I have more in common with Grandpa than I can imagine. Come and explore how two different people make a connection.

results.title: Soldier On
results.brief_description: Written from a collection of true stories, this film shows a boy of 15 years old delivering a message through an interview that must be heard and understood. Relationships are how we all connect in life, so make yours positive. Written, directed and edited by Billy Peters, performed by Conor Merrigan-Turner.

results.title: The Tank Gang: A Say No to Bullies Story
results.creator_credit: Willem Durrand, Tahalia Durrand and Ruben Durrand
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Tank Gang. The Tank Gang love playing together, even with Jack, the bully. One day, Jack goes too far and the Tank Gang see how putting up with Jack has meant that their friend got hurt. The friends all learn the importance of standing up for each other, not bullying and being good friends.

results.title: Max's Farm
results.brief_description: Max is a perfectionist. He loves his farm and wants it to be the best. The ‘Farmer’s Weekly’ arrives and his farm rates 27th. That’s a great score, but Max wants it number 1. He tries to improve his farm by eliminating what he thinks are pests, but that just makes his farm worse. He has to find out how to get things work together.
